Hi,
I am new to this site, and I am very interested in doing reearch
relate=
d to the NEAT framework, but I am having som problem compiling
the release.=
 First, I see in the group that compiling for newer
machined is a bit of a =
challenge, especially due to gtk and gcc.

However, I find that rtNEAT has =
all the functonalliti of NEAT (plus
the real time evolution loop) so I deci=
ded to try this one,
downloading the newest version on: http://nn.cs.utexas=
.edu/keyword?rtneat.

However it just does not compile, and I am not profic=
cient in C or C++
coding so I haven been able to solve this problem myself.=


Can anyone please help me with this?

This is the error message I recieve=
 when I attempt to compile:

g++ -o3 -g -Wall  -c network.cpp -o network.o
=
nnode.h:163: error: `Network' has not been declared
network.h:37: error: IS=
O C++ forbids declaration of `Genome' with no type
network.h:37: error: exp=
ected `;' before `*' token
network.cpp: In member function `int NEAT::Netwo=
rk::max_depth()':
network.cpp:599: error: no matching function for call to
=
`NEAT::NNode::depth(int, NEAT::Network* const)'
nnode.h:163: note: candidat=
es are: int NEAT::NNode::depth(int, int*)
make: *** [network.o] Error 1

I =
am a Debian user (Ubuntu)

Thanks for any help.
Leo
